• Urine: when passed
Indications for earlier vaginal examination (than 4-hourly interval): 
• If the woman has an urge to bear down
• If the fetal and/or maternal condition is non-reassuring
Indications for referral: 
• If the maternal and/or fetal condition is non-reassuring
• If there is MSL AND delivery is NOT imminent
• If there is poor progress of labour
• If there are signs of cephalo-pelvic disproportion (CPD) i.e. 2+ or 3+ sagittal moulding and th
